SEARCH
Package ie.atu.sw

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
ie.atu.sw.Menu
public class Menu extends Object
This class is used for menu related things such as: the menu for the user -(1) Specify a text file for analysis, -(2) Specify a path for a text resource to analyze for example tweets aka twitter url(not literally a url in this case), -(3)Save the output to a specified file, -(4) Enter lexicon file path that will be used, -(5) Display the results of the lexicon comparison to the resource and output the result to the file if the user has specified the output file location, -(6) quit

  • Method Details

    • RunMenu

      public boolean RunMenu()
      This method call all of the functions for menu to make code in runner neat developers note: when I made userChoice 1,3,4 I did not understand what the url meant gathering from context now i understand it means to specify a tweet or tweets for the sentiment processing class to know what to do as Scanner is not threadSafe. so programming choice 2 came after I had made the sentiment processor at the time of doing 1,3,4 I forgot that talking to multiple classes would be made simple and secure with the use of a private variable and public gets with a private sets, however this is a lot to reactor so I will leave it the way it is due to time.
      Returns:
      when return false the program was exited, when return true the program calls the calculation in main

    • configureInputTxtFileLocation

      public String configureInputTxtFileLocation()
      This method allows the user to configure the text file location for the text file they want to read for sentiment analysis
      Returns:
      true if file resource exists, false if not

    • specifyURL

      public int specifyURL()
      This method asks the user to specify which line of text they want to use from their file
      Returns:
      the line they chose

    • configureOutputTxtFileLocation

      public String configureOutputTxtFileLocation()
      This method is for specifying where you would like to save the results received from the sentiment analysis function
      Returns:
      a valid file path or return empty String

    • configureLexiconPath

      public String configureLexiconPath()
      Method to get the file path for the lexicon
      Returns:
      returns a path for the lexicon if found if not an empty string is passed
